intro: Meryta microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited meryta, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark red color, containing several seeds. Meryta microcarpa is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
